titleStmt.title: Anglia rediviva being a full description of all the shires, cities, principal towns and rivers, in England : with some useful observations concerning what is most remarkable ... : to which is prefix'd a short account of the first origine of our nation, of its being conquer'd by the Romans, as also the occasion of the Saxons and Danes first entring England / collected from the best historians by Mr. Dunstar.
titleStmt.author: Dunstar, Mr. (Samuel), 1675-1754.

titleStmt.title: Anglia rediviva being a full description of all the shires, cities, principal towns and rivers, in England : with some useful observations concerning what is most remarkable ... : to which is prefix'd a short account of the first origine of our nation, of its being conquer'd by the Romans, as also the occasion of the Saxons and Danes first entring England / collected from the best historians by Mr. Dunstar.
titleStmt.author: Dunstar, Mr. (Samuel), 1675-1754.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for T. Bennet [and three others],

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Tables of cities, counties, and inhabitants: p. [2]-[9] at end.
